Articles.Content:
He really took the "one with the ship" thing seriously...

There's no getting him out and it's causing the Station to... Experience intriguing anomalies...
Hit it with a REALLY BIG HAMMER.

Hit it with a REALLY BIG HAMMER.

http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120112195131/marveldatabase/images/6/60/Mjolnir_the_Mighty_Hammer_of_Thor.jpg

The thing is already falling apart...

Or at least it did before I F9'd out of it...

Hit it with a REALLY BIG HAMMER.

http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120112195131/marveldatabase/images/6/60/Mjolnir_the_Mighty_Hammer_of_Thor.jpg

Wait a minute! Are spoilers working again?!

On topic: Yea, Bob is a strange Kerbal, always doing the most confusing things.

EDIT:

Since WHEN did this start working? I thought they were disabled?

Edited March 21, 2014 by RocketPilot573

There should be a nondestructive way.

a) Bob is not on a ladder. Start warping the time. 10x. He is a separate "vessel" so he should glide away, as during regular warp, vessels are on rails.

If for some reason KSP doesn't let you warp, you need an active object not attached to the station, with almost zero relative motion. Then you warp. Watch Bob, he should slide out.

That's all I can think of. You could try whack-a-Kerbal (in alt+F12 menu), but that might be destructive.

There should be a nondestructive way.

a) Bob is not on a ladder. Start warping the time. 10x. He is a separate "vessel" so he should glide away, as during regular warp, vessels are on rails.

If for some reason KSP doesn't let you warp, you need an active object not attached to the station, with almost zero relative motion. Then you warp. Watch Bob, he should slide out.

That's all I can think of. You could try whack-a-Kerbal (in alt+F12 menu), but that might be destructive.

Nah... F9 took care of it with no risk to the station or crew.

EVA was done by Camoly Kerman instead this time, he's got a better grasp on the Jetpack controls...

The moral of this event was- be careful when you try to grab a ladder with your Kerman, he might go for one that's covered up by other parts (in this instance, the FusTek hatch ladder got grabbed, instead of the visible yellow ladder/railing)...

P.S: It didn't let me warp as Bob was clipping through the S6 rings, causing them to do weird things and thus "accelerate" the station making the "Cannot warp while under acceleration" thing come up...

Edited March 21, 2014 by BananaDealer

Wait a minute! Are spoilers working again?!

On topic: Yea, Bob is a strange Kerbal, always doing the most confusing things.

EDIT:

Since WHEN did this start working? I thought they were disabled?

KasperVld's been cobbling together a less flimsy version of them. They may or may not change from now till final implementation with regards to exactly how to they work/look/etc.

As to Bob, well, I guess you could attempt to Terminate him from the Tracking Station...
Both spoiler tags resulted in being taken back to the main forum. They may not work now, but I have good feelings!

Both spoiler tags resulted in being taken back to the main forum. They may not work now, but I have good feelings!

They work for me.

Bob has suffered through so many indignities. Being the least stupid of the grand trio, I'm amazed he continues to put up with it.

Still, any kerbal is liable to find their head stuck in a hatch or engine bell at some point in their career...
Just time warp for a bit. Two objects never share the exact same orbit, so eventually he'll phase through whatever it is he's stuck on.
